Dear Sir,

I'm one of your thousands of silent followers here in the Pirate Bay and once I found out your impressive ability to attend obscure requests (X-Men Forever Vol. 1 and Vol. 2, for example) I finally took the time to register only to ask you for a favor.

You see, I'm a fan of the X-Men comics, particularly those of the Claremont-Byrne era, so, I'd like to ask you to upload the Classic X-Men issues (#01-#110) or at least the X-Men Vignettes Vols. (#01 and #02).

What I like most of this series (excluding the original stories) is the art of John Bolton illustrating the usually mesmerizing backup stories written by Chris Claremont himself. 

I know Claremont did stopped to write those stories after a while, but these first ones alone have blown my mind when I first read them. And i recall there were a few sketches and wonderful Arthur Adams and Steve Lightle covers and pinups included that I'm sure it would also be a dream come true to many people around the world downloading all those 110 issues, particularly if scanned in good quality.

So, if by any chance I failed in making myself clear, since english is not my first (nor second) language, here are a few links to help you understand what I'm looking for:

Classic X-Men:
http://www.comicvine.com/classic-x-men/4050-3626/

X-Men: Vignettes, Vol. 1 [Paperback]
http://www.amazon.com/X-Men-Vignettes-Vol-Chris-Claremont/dp/0785108122

X-Men: Vignettes, Vol. 2 [Paperback]
http://www.amazon.com/X-Men-Vignettes-Vol-Chris-Claremont/dp/0785117288

Thank you very much for your time and dedication sharing all those comics.

Excelsior!

ggaanneesshhaa, i can't deny your polite request.

however, it will take awhile to compile that series.

right now i've been collecting another requested series (ALF, from marvel's star comics). i have some other requests waiting. but i'll try to get it to classic x-men next week, perhaps monday?

i will probably collect the classic x-men issues that had new backup stories (john bolton did a great job on those). after classic x-men #1-45, it was renamed x-men classic and #45-110 are really just reprints with new cover art.

so to fill your request, i will probably do 2 torrents: 1. classic x-men and 2. x-men classic.

STFmaryville, thanks very much for the information and the links.
